instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3435-A doesn't see battery
threads.message: hello i got macbook air 820-3435 that doesn't see the battery. Everytime I unplugged the magsafe it shuts off. It looks like my SMC is fried. My diode mode reading on chgr_cso_n - 0.134 & chgr_cso_p - 0.135. I already try replacing it but im still having the same problem. ISL6259 has already been replaced as well. any suggestions?

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3435-A doesn't see battery
threads.message: I replaced smc but it still doesn't appear. any ideas?

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3435-A doesn't see battery
threads.message: Forgive me here but, have you tried a know good battery?

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3435-A doesn't see battery
threads.message:
Is recognized on OS?
Resistance between pins 17/18 from U7100??
Diode mode on data lines from battery conector.??

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3435-A doesn't see battery
threads.message: Yes I did! Still same problem.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3435-A doesn't see battery
threads.message: Bleep out the SDA SCL lines

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3435-A doesn't see battery
threads.message: the battery wasnt been recognize by the OS. During inspection i found the lines SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA & SDL were shorted to ground.  After correcting the bad soldering (pin 10 & 11) on isl6259 the battery was back in action. i cant believe I miss tis. Thanks for the input guys!
